title: Vampiros Mexicanos (Mexican Vampires) Recipe
description: Vampiros Mexicanos is an authentic Mexican cocktail. It's easy to make by combining, in one glass, the best of Mexico: tequila and sangrita!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Vampiros Mexicanos (Mexican Vampires) 4.7 (3) 3 Reviews 3 Photos Vampiros Mexicanos is a real Mexican cocktail! This drink combines, in one glass, the best of Mexico: tequila and sangrita (Mexican's favorite tequila chaser). Don't look for cheap tequila; if you like the good stuff, don't be afraid to mix it. Submitted by gem Updated on November 15, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 3 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 1 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 1 cup ice cubes, or as needed 3 ounces sangrita (Mexican-style bloody mary mix with orange and lime) 1 ½ fluid ounces silver tequila (100% agave) 1 ½ ounces citrus-flavored soda (such as Squirt) ½ lime, juiced 1 pinch Mexican-style chili powder with lime (such as Tajin fruit seasoning) Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Fill a highball glass with ice cubes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour in sangrita, tequila, citrus soda, lime juice, and chili-lime seasoning. Stir to mix well. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note Make your own delicious sangrita and enjoy a truly authentic cocktail. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Vampiros Mexicanos (Mexican Vampires) 01 of 03 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 03 Photo by  Evelina Berumen 03/21/2018 03 of 03 Photo by  acglock 07/29/2014 Worth tracking down the authentic ingredients! The taste is sweet, tangy, salty, and spicy! Unique! I salted the rim with black lava salt, but the Sangrita really makes it salty enough. Squirt is unique too... try to find it. 1 You’ll Also Love Paloma Picante 2 Ratings Clamato Michelada Perfecta 3 Ratings Strawberry Basil Margarita 55 Ratings Patron Mojito 6 Ratings A Big, Honkin' Margarita 3 Ratings Margaritas Maravillosos 3 Ratings Magnificent Mango Margaritas 16 Ratings Lauren's Grapefruit Margaritas 34 Ratings Blackberry-Mint Julep Margarita Frozen Mint Julep Margarita Coconut Margarita 16 Ratings Margarita On The Rocks 34 Ratings Jalapeño Margaritas 50 Ratings Limeshot Mexi-Martini 1 Rating Mexican Peach 2 Ratings Classic Frozen Strawberry Margarita 17 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
